medical_history.chief_complaint: Gingival bleeding after periodontal scaling of her lower-right second molar.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Bleeding started 5 hours prior to clinic visit and persisted despite application of pressure and ice. The patient recalls a similar episode 6 months earlier after a periodontal procedure, where bleeding stopped only after applying firm pressure for 6 hours.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension and deep-vein thrombosis occurring 20 years earlier while on oral contraceptives; underwent cosmetic blepharoplasty in her 20s and arthroscopic repair of a meniscal tear of the left knee 1 year prior, both without complications.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of lung cancer at age 62; mother is 88 and in good health; brother diagnosed with colorectal cancer at age 57; no family history of bleeding diathesis.
medical_history.social_history: Retired attorney, lives with husband and has one adult son. Quit smoking 30 years ago, occasionally consumes alcohol.
